definition: taxi driver

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax
to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)
surname Si
machine/engine/opportunity/intention/aircraft/pivot/crucial point/flexible (quick-witted)/organic/CL:臺|台[tai2]
surname Ji
chauffeur/driver/CL:個|个[ge4]
taxi/(Tw) rental car
male taxi driver/cabbie (slang)
to refuse to take a passenger (of taxi)
unlicensed or unofficial taxi/unlicensed motor vehicle
(northern dialect) to pick up a fare (as a taxi driver)/to pick up a piece of work (as a courier)
pedicab driver
ticket seller
to solicit (guests, clients, passengers etc)/to importune
to take a taxi (in town)/to hitch a lift
to drive a vehicle for its owner (often as a paid service for sb who has consumed alcohol) (abbr. for 代理駕駛|代理驾驶[dai4 li3 jia4 shi3])/substitute driver (abbr. for 代駕司機|代驾司机[dai4 jia4 si1 ji1])
to run the meter (in a taxi)
passenger
person who joins with others to reduce costs (carpooling, group buying, sharing an apartment etc)
to thumb a lift/to hitchhike
motorcycle taxi/abbr. for 摩托車的士|摩托车的士[mo2 tuo1 che1 di1 shi4]
